31
A GIFT IN THE FORM OF A SECURITY
When a gift is a security for the benefit of the person it has been given to, the value of the gift shall be calculated as a sum of all the premiums the decedent has paid, provided the sum is smaller than the sum insured; if the sum of the paid premiums is higher than the sum insured, the sum insured shall be considered to be the value of the gift.
